intro: Planchonella baueri var. brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed pandanus, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its compact, woody structure and clustered leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal or mangrove areas, where it thrives in saline and humid conditions. Its leaves are often used in traditional crafts and as thatching materials. The fruit, though not widely cultivated, is edible and has a mild, sweet flavor.
